column4: Installed 12.04 (Desktop) on a 2nd harddrive (/dev/sdb) and It destroyed my MBR (/dev/sda) which now doesnt let me boot Windows 7 or Ubuntu 12.04. After using boot-repair, I am able to boot Ubuntu (/dev/sdb) but os-prober and grub-install will not and have not found my Windows 7 Install.. Not Happy.. plz help
Why is there NO option in the Desktop LiveCD version to leave the MBR untouched?
I want a solution that doesnt involve another piece of software (much like boot-repair that caused more damage than helped)
why does "sudo os-prober" NOT find my Windows 7 disk/partitions?
and I am familiar with boot-repair.. Ubuntu 12.04 Desktop LiveCD is the culprut.. not boot-repair..
have you tried using the windows 7 repair install?
then boot-repairing from the live cd see if that helps?
just a suggestion because grub has had 0 problems detecting my windows 7 install
which is why I'm thinking there is something wrong with it.
sorry if you already posted, but what is your partition/drive setup like?
the link I posted gave your instructions for fixing it yourself
im not running scripts from forums on my machine
apparently you didnt read it when I said I dont want any software
frankly I don't like your attitude
